intro: Gnaphalium cabrerae, commonly known as the Canary Island cudweed, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in its arid habitat.
